thread.title: 23 Magical Places Everyone Must Visit In The UK
thread.title_full: 23 Magical Places Everyone Must Visit In The UK

author: Ailbhe Malone
title: 23 Magical Places Everyone Must Visit In The UK
text:
View this image › 
Flickr: matthewhartley369 “There’s a small beach area where many caves and small pools of water are located, good for those who love to explore. There’s only a certain time of day you can visit too as the tide goes up very quickly.” – sophieb483cbacae 
ID: 10441084 2. The Outer Hebrides View this image › 
Flickr: seaofvapours “This summer I’m doing a 10-day tour of the outer Hebrides in Scotland. 10 days of standing stones, fairy pools, and Viking settlements. HEAVEN! Or, should I say, VALHALLA!” – beckie 
ID: 10441092 3. The Roseland Peninsula, Falmouth View this image › 
Tom Tolkein / Via thomastolkien.wordpress.com “The Roseland Peninsula, on the other side of Carrick Roads from Falmouth. Taking the ferry across the harbour to St Mawes and then an even smaller ferry across to St Anthony, walking around the peninsula, exploring the little beaches and coves, then getting the ferries back, walking across Falmouth and chilling out on Gyllyngvase beach. Perfect way to spend a hot summers day.” – Tom McAteer, Facebook
ID: 10441045 4. Longleat, Wiltshire View this image › 
Flickr: worldoflard “There’s a beautiful path through the forest to a hill overlooking the Longleat estate and safari, in Wiltshire. The locals all call it Heavens Gate you can see for miles and it’s especially glorious at sunset!” – zoeye2 
(This photo is of Wiltshire, not specifically Longleat)
ID: 10441115 5. Vindolanda, Hexham View this image › 
Flickr: michaelloudon “I recently visited Hadrian’s wall and i would strongly recommend that to everyone. Vindolanda is amazing!!” – matthews4db7f00b2 
ID: 10441086 6. The Durdle Door, Dorset View this image › 
Flickr: montpelier “Beautiful” – yolandaw415afa4e4 
ID: 10441081 7. Kinver Rock Houses, Staffordshire View this image › 
Flickr: 23967095@N00 “They’re so unique and their history is fascinating. And the surrounding area is beautiful, too!” – sofamiliar 
ID: 10441121 8. St Abb’s Head, Berwickshire View this image › 
Flickr: barryj “The area around St Abb’s Head in Berwickshire, south east Scotland is beautiful. There are steep cliffs, but if you walk far enough you can find a ruined castle out on a tiny island.” – anniem4f5db16fc 
ID: 10441124 9. Dunster, Somerset View this image › 
Flickr: philny – nicolem49c566b25 
ID: 10441097 10. Sugar Loaf Mountain, Monmouthshire View this image › 
Flickr: doug_from_the_uk “You have to include Sugar Loaf Mountain in Monmouthshire, Wales. I took myself off to Wales a couple of weeks after my 30th Birthday last year, staying in Cardiff for a solo holiday. I googled things to do nearby, next thing I know I’m on a train to Abergavenny on a mission!
“The views were beautiful, and little did I know when I woke up that day that a couple of hours later I’d be up the top of a mountain, chatting to strangers and more importantly petting their dogs, so far removed from my normal London life!” – michaele44634e500 
ID: 10441132 11. The Shell Grotto, Margate View this image › 
Flickr: kotomi-jewelry “It’s fascinating and gorgeous – and how the place came to be is still a mystery. Even reading the Wikipedia page makes it sound amazing. ” – sophiab42cf32be2 
ID: 10441129 12. Dean Village, Edinburgh View this image › 
Flickr: 91451979@N00 – pault32 
ID: 10441082 13. Lerwick, Shetland View this image › 
Flickr: neil_roger “The Clickimin Loch is lovely at night when you look across to the Broch.” – kerrym4703fbb7f” 
ID: 10441048 14. St David’s, Wales View this image › 
Flickr: 16801915@N06 “St Davids, the smallest city in the UK (pop. 1,841). The main attraction is the cathedral, which holds the relics of St David (unsurprisingly), Wales’ patron saint. The cathedral close is particularly beautiful, since it contains several ruined medieval buildings, including the bishop’s palace, as well as quite a few cows in the meadows by the river. Oh, the city is also in the middle of the Pembrokeshire Coast National Park, the only National Park designated primarily because of its coastline, which is truly spectacular.” – clickbaitmcclickface 
ID: 10441053 15. Isle of Skye View this image › 
Flickr: brynj “Isle of Skye is pure magic… The Quirang is like walking in another world. You’ll never forget it.” – tacodingo2 
ID: 10441087 16. Cragside House, Northumberland View this image › 
Flickr: xlibber “It was the first home in the world to take advantage of hydro power to generate electricity for the home, and it’s got vast grounds to explore. It’s kinda like if Willy Wonka and Frankenstein designed a stately home. Oh and it’s beautiful.” – johntheone 
ID: 10441101 17. Ladybower Reservoir, Derbyshire View this image › 
Flickr: 85520404@N03 “There’s a place in the peak district. Ladybower Reservoir, it is a beautiful expanse of water, if you know the right way to go, it leads to “Slippery Stones” A natural water swimming spot, and its super pretty in summer.” – Linkakq 
ID: 10441103 18. Tollymore forest park, County Down View this image › 
Flickr: robertpaulyoung – dangerxdays 
ID: 10441112 19. Inverie, Lochaber View this image › 
Flickr: smagdali “The main village on the Knoydart peninsula on the West coast of Scotland. It isn’t connected to the main road network so it is only accessible by ferry (or a 17 mile hike!). It’s incredibly beautiful with wonderful views of the islands Rum, Eigg and Muck and Sgurr Coire Choinnichean as an incredible mountain background.
“It’s also home to The Old Forge, which is the most remote pub in mainland Britain!” – hjj2 
ID: 10441051 20. Millport, near Glasgow View this image › 
Flickr: headphonaught “It’s a beautiful tiny isle near Glasgow. You can rent bikes and cycle around the island in about 1-2 hours. Both cafés, one close to the ferry port and one in the ‘town’ part are absolutely delicious. Biggest attraction? Crocodile Rock for sure. It’s absolutely worth going to since it is such a magical and beautiful place to be.” – laram45f255215 
ID: 10441120 21. Giant’s Causeway, Antrim View this image › 
Flickr: kloppster “Giants Causeway, County Antrim. Easily.” – annam4c7ab19bb 
ID: 10441122 22. Beddgelert, Snowdonia View this image › 
Flickr: franganillo “Absolutely stunning.” – cerysedwards 
ID: 10441136 23. Wells-Next-The-Sea, Norfolk View this image › 
Flickr: freddiebrown “The vast beach and the colourful huts at Wells-Next-The-Sea, North Norfolk.” – danm49cb25d99” 
ID: 10441142 Want to be featured in similar BuzzFeed posts? Follow the BuzzFeed Community on Facebook and Twitter ! ID: 10449485   
Ailbhe
